intro: Viola biflora subsp. carlottae, commonly known as the Carlotta violet, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
